justification: The article states: “Strength of the evidence is summarized by a 1-5 ‘security’ rating. The padlock rating assesses internal validity (EEF, 2016).”
It notes that communications list uncertainties "along with a rating of the certainty of the evidence using GRADE by both a four-star system and a verbal descriptor."

When discussing evaluated formats the review reports that health policy summaries often relied on “GRADE evidence tables (e.g., Carrasco-Labra et al., 2016; Treweek et al., 2013)” to convey information about evidence quality.
